result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron Jones was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Solicitation of Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court did not address defendant's eligibility for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

miscConds.notes:
**12-14-15/ Judge Thomas J McAdams**
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $2,804.00, Joint & Several, with co-defendant Aric D Jones (15CF1671), payable to Leon L. Williamson Funeral Home

Court imposes applicable fees, assessments, court costs and surcharges, including DNA (and you may have to give  swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77).
To be paid over the duration of Probation; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Defendant's voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work.
Defendant is eligible for the Interstate Compact Program.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
On December 14, 2015 restitution was ordered to Leon Williamson Funeral Home.  Dept. of Corrections has contacted the court to report that the funeral home has been paid in full by two payees; further, the amount paid by the two payees does not equal the amount of restitution ordered.  Dept. of Corrections has submitted an order for the court's signature for an Amended Judgment of Conviction.
Due to the discrepancies involved with the request by DOC, Court is requesting hearing be scheduled.  Deputy clerk to contact the parties as to scheduling of further restitution hearing.
Clerk:  jms
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to BRANCH 28, JUDGE SANDERS for review.

records.addlTxt: Reflects assessment of 5% restitution surcharge, not on original JOC/ CR-154
CASE CALLED TO CORRECT 11.9.15 ENTRY. RECORD SHOULD REFLECT A FELONY H AS TO COUNT 2.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, Defendant Aaron Jones not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.  Restitution set at $2,804.00 jointly and severally with co-defendant Aric D. Jones (15CF001671) to Leon L. Williamson Funeral Home. Receipt received and filed with court.

Defendant Aaron Jones in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Aaron Jones in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered added Count 2 Solicitation of Possession of a Firearm - Adjudged Delinquent, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.29(2)(b) 939.50(3)(g) 939.50, a Felony. 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to Count 2.
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Trial date is converted to a sentencing date.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, State's Response to Defendant's Motion Challenging Admissibility of On-Scene Statement.
State's Requested Jury Intructions received and filed with court.
Received and filed with court.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Aaron Jones not in court, in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are still in negotiations. An arraignment on the Amended Information will be done on the next court date. Case adjourned for a motion hearing and final pretrial.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List and State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Letter from defendant's mother.
Defendant's Request for Speedy Trial.
Defendant's Motion Challenging the Admissibility of His On-Scene Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Aaron Jones in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Aaron Jones in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel previously filed a motion to sever this case with the co-defendant's matter. State does not object to severance. Court granted defense request and ordered this matter severed with case 15CF1671. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 7/27/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Severance received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Cover letter with attached DVD of defendant's recorded statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Aaron Jones's Motion to Sever Cases received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Aaron Jones in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Aaron Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel is missing some discovery that is related to the motion to sever and requested an adjournment of the motion hearing. State and co-defendant's counsel do not object to an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Aaron Jones not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Discussion regarding the status of this case. Defense may be filing a motion to sever with the co-defendant's case (15CF1671). Defense to file motions by 5/21/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Received and filed wtih court.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gust Petropoulous-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Aaron Jones in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Aaron Jones in custody.  Antoni Apollo for Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT. Charges and penalities remain the same. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter on behalf of the defendant with attachment received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MONICA M., RHONDA T., TONY C. AND CO-DEF:  ARIC JONES.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aaron Jones in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Aaron Jones in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA TO BE TAKEN.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
